intro: Dalechampia cynanchoides, commonly known as the Mexican dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are usually deeply lobed and have a distinctive appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Dalechampia cynanchoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
